data.job_description:
Please review the job details below.

Maxar's Data Science Services team is looking for a Data Scientist. We use a robust, flexible framework developed by our Applied Machine Learning team to deliver impactful and imaginative solutions to our internal and external partners. We are always on the lookout for the next innovative idea to help our customers discover the art of the possible, as well as how to scale those ideas for future endeavors.

Life with Us

Project: The Data Scientist is expected to respond tactfully to customer requirements, guided by a deep understanding of data science methodologies as well as the ability to see patterns in the data. The Data Scientist will report to a Technical Program Manager and have the support of a DSS Technical Lead who will help guide them to execute requests from a wide variety of customers, promote career progression, and communicate emerging patterns with the ML Engineering team.

Your Career: We’re very serious about professional development and continuing education. We offer everyone the opportunity to define their own career trajectory. Our group has some amazing resources at its disposal specifically for this purpose. You will work with your direct supervisor and/or a mentor to set appropriate goals and design a plan to help you make consistent progress.

We offer:
• Dedicated professional development time.
• Conference attendance.
• Corporate partner, industry training.
• Peer groups.
• Paid certifications.
• Education reimbursement.
• Hackathons.
• and much more...

Day-to-day with your colleagues:
• You’ll be creating bespoke AI/ML customer solutions using Maxar’s Applied Machine Learning Technology Stack.
• You’ll be discovering new and innovative features to add to the Applied Machine Learning Technology Stack so that it continues to cater to a wide customer base.
• We work in a very Lean-Agile environment without the overhead associated with traditional Scrum. We’ve eliminated unnecessary development meetings and we love it!
• You’ll collaborate with our geographically dispersed team primarily via Zoom & Slack.

Minimum Requirements:
• Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance with CI Polygraph.
• Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Systems Engineering, etc.), or equivalent experience.
• 5+ years of data science-related experience.
• Strong Python skills.
• Modeling, analysis, and/or hypothesis testing using statistical techniques and data visualization.
• Recent experience with some of the following technologies:
• AWS/C2S/S3;
• PyTorch;
• GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.

Preferred Requirements:
• Active TS/SCI security clearance with CI Polygraph (preferred but not required).
• Experience with satellite imagery and/or aerial imagery and general mapping.
• Experience with 3D and elevation data.
• Experience with QGIS or similar technologies.
• Experience with PyTorch Lightning, GraphQL.
• Experience with Kubeflow / MLflow.
• Understanding of Agile methodologies.
• Advanced degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Systems Engineering, etc.), or equivalent experience.
• Strong background in remote sensing or computer vision.
• Knowledge of Design Thinking principles.

Our salary ranges are market-driven and set to allow for flexibility. Individual pay will be competitive based on a candidate’s unique set of knowledge, skills, and geographic diversity, with earnings potential commensurate with experience. The range for this position is:
$107,000.00 - $179,000.00 annually.

Maxar employees must follow all applicable Maxar policies and COVID-19 requirements as well as those of Maxar customers and third parties. Individual job requirements may vary, and Maxar reserves the right to modify its policies and requirements as it deems appropriate in accordance with applicable law.

Maxar Technologies values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

data.job_title: Data Scientist (SAS)/ Sr. Demand Planning Analyst
data.job_description:
Requisition ID: 23340

A Career in Beer and Beyond:

Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company is to brew beverages that unite people to celebrate all life’s moments. We’ve been brewing iconic brands for over 350 years and are now proud to be offering a modern portfolio that expands beyond the beer aisle.

We are Talent Brewers with our culture rooted in our core Values. We believe in our brands and our people, and that diversity WITH inclusion is the key to a winning team culture. We want you to join our team of brand ambassadors who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.

The Headlines:

In the role of Sr. Statistical Forecaster working in Milwaukee, WI, you will be the key to success for the entire forecasting process. The Sr. Statistical Forecaster creates the statistical baseline volume forecast at a Province, Customer, Planning location, SKU, and week level within SAS. This includes continuous modeling for all Brands, Retail & On Premise, Craft, Imports, and new products for a two-year horizon (3M data combinations in a week). Additionally, this role supports the end-to-end forecast process by executing SAS processes including new product introductions, large-scale data adjustments, and maintaining the collaboration insight overlays.

This position reports to the Demand Manager for Canada.

The Responsibilities:
• Create, modify, and execute statistical models for all aspects of the Canada Region (6M hectoliter business) across 3+ million data points
• Evaluates effectiveness of base stat forecast at varying levels and provides recommendations on different forecast models/parameters to optimize weekly forecast.
• Update parameters to forecast such as outlier detection/correction, forecast parameters for execution, and iteratively executes forecast process to ensure best fit modeling
• Support design, development, implementation, and execution of improvement processes / systems related to demand planning for Canada
• New product forecasting across the portfolio with a strong partnership with the Project Management Office and the Demand Planning team, and includes master data validation, identifying proxy SKUs, determining SKU cannibalization
• Create and maintain a volume forecast for the "next Year" that will be leveraged in the annual operating planning (AOP) process as the "business as usual" volume base.
• Drives for continuous improvement of forecast accuracy by using collaboration and communication of STR forecast performance and key business drivers
• SAS programming

The Other Qualifications:
• You are an authentic leader. You value and respect differences and believe diversity with inclusion is the key to collaboration and a winning team culture
• You have a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics OR equivalent experience (4+ years) in the field
• You have at least 3-5 years experience in Statistical forecasting, statistical modeling, SAS software
• Statistical Forecasting methods, outlier correction, adjusting parameters
• Knowledge of SAS EG data and SAS landscape preferred
• Statistical Forecasting methods and models
• Strong MS Excel skills to generate reports that utilize both SAS data sets and Excel sheets as input
• Strong ability to collaborate with Demand Planner team members, commercial, and brand teams
• You love a challenge. You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities
• You build relationships and collaborate to get to the desired outcome
• You take accountability for results – acting with integrity and honoring commitments
• You have a thirst for learning – you are always looking for ways to learn and help one another grow
• You exhibit our core values

Work Perks that You Need to Know About:
• Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office
• We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities
• We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are
• Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization
• Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities
• Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental, vision, 401k option with incredible employer match, generous paid time off plans, an engaging Wellness Program, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) with amazing resources
• On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages!
• Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences

At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

Qualifications: You are an authentic leader
You have a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics OR equivalent experience (4+ years) in the field
You have at least 3-5 years experience in Statistical forecasting, statistical modeling, SAS software
Statistical Forecasting methods, outlier correction, adjusting parameters
Statistical Forecasting methods and models
Strong MS Excel skills to generate reports that utilize both SAS data sets and Excel sheets as input
Strong ability to collaborate with Demand Planner team members, commercial, and brand teams
You love a challenge
You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities
You have a thirst for learning – you are always looking for ways to learn and help one another grow
Responsibilities: The Sr. Statistical Forecaster creates the statistical baseline volume forecast at a Province, Customer, Planning location, SKU, and week level within SAS
This includes continuous modeling for all Brands, Retail & On Premise, Craft, Imports, and new products for a two-year horizon (3M data combinations in a week)

Additionally, this role supports the end-to-end forecast process by executing SAS processes including new product introductions, large-scale data adjustments, and maintaining the collaboration insight overlays
Create, modify, and execute statistical models for all aspects of the Canada Region (6M hectoliter business) across 3+ million data points
Evaluates effectiveness of base stat forecast at varying levels and provides recommendations on different forecast models/parameters to optimize weekly forecast
Update parameters to forecast such as outlier detection/correction, forecast parameters for execution, and iteratively executes forecast process to ensure best fit modeling
Support design, development, implementation, and execution of improvement processes / systems related to demand planning for Canada

New product forecasting across the portfolio with a strong partnership with the Project Management Office and the Demand Planning team, and includes master data validation, identifying proxy SKUs, determining SKU cannibalization
Create and maintain a volume forecast for the "next Year" that will be leveraged in the annual operating planning (AOP) process as the "business as usual" volume base
Drives for continuous improvement of forecast accuracy by using collaboration and communication of STR forecast performance and key business drivers
SAS programming
You build relationships and collaborate to get to the desired outcome
You take accountability for results – acting with integrity and honoring commitments
Benefits: Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office
Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities

Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental, vision, 401k option with incredible employer match, generous paid time off plans, an engaging Wellness Program, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) with amazing resources
On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course..

The Data Scientist position is responsible to research and apply knowledge of existing and emerging data science principles, theories, and techniques to inform business decisions. Analysis may be applied to various areas of the business (e.g., Market Economics, Supply Chain, Marketing/Advertising, Scientific Research, etc.). A Lead Professional position is a recognized subject matter expert in a job area typically obtained through advanced education and work experience. Problems faced are difficult and often complex. Requires periodic communication and interaction with leadership.

Leads large projects or processes of complex scope, with limited oversight from manager
Coaches, reviews and delegates work to lower level professionals
Assists in the development of operational plan and implements for areas of assigned responsibilities
Identifies continuous improvement/automation activities
Conduct scientific research projects with the goal of breaking new ground in data analytics
Creates data mining architectures/models/protocols, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets
Supports relationships through strong communication and negotiation skills with internal and external stakeholders
Other duties as assigned

Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a bachelor's degree; or 6 years and a master's degree; or a PhD with 3 years of experience; or equivalent work experience

data.job_description:
Description

The Integrated Data and Analytics (IDA) team in Hennepin County’s Strategic Planning and Analytics department is seeking a Data Scientist to generate actionable insights in support of key county strategies. This position will develop data science and advanced analytics projects, in partnership with county staff from concept to production. This position will analyze data from large databases, perform ad-hoc analyses, support the development of county dataOps, develop a variety of reports and data products, and present results to key stakeholders to address complex organizational problems.

Current Hennepin County employees who refer a candidate hired into an open competitive position may be eligible for a $500 re ferral bonus. For more information visit employee referral program .

Location and hours:

This position is remote. Remote workers may be required to come on-site an average of 0 to 12 days a year for work meetings, trainings, or for any other reasons that their supervisor may deem necessary (may include additional days for onboarding and new employee training). Supervisors will provide as much advance notice as practicable. Work hours are 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. with flexibility.

While this position is designated as remote, based on current requirements hires must reside in Minnesota or Wisconsin.

New employees who are hired into remote or hybrid positions between January 2, 2022 to December 31, 2024, will receive $500 toward the cost of establishing consistent internet connectivity, payable upon completion of 6 months of employment.

About The Position Type

This is a full-time, benefit earning position. This position is internally classified as a Planning Analyst, Principal. Click here to view the job classification specification.

In This Position, You Will
• Develop data science, advanced analytics, and complex reporting projects from concept to production, based on business need.
• Query, transform, and clean data from a variety of state and county databases, for use in data science and analytics projects.
• Identify new datasets and approaches for mining existing data.
• Execute ad-hoc analyses, ongoing models, and report development to solve various problems and meaningfully impact county strategies.
• Analyze, interpret, and present data to meet the needs of multiple stakeholders and diverse audiences.
• Advance practices related to report automation, data processes, and data-ops.
• Support data informed decision making and culture through data science initiatives, user adoption plans and data literacy related efforts.
Need to have:
• One of the following:
• Bachelor's degree or higher in any field and a minimum of two courses in data science, research methods, data analytics, or statistics and four years or more of relevant data analyst, data science, or applied research experience.
• Bachelor's degree or higher in one of the fields listed below and three years or more of relevant data analyst, data science, or applied research experience.
• Master's degree or higher in one of the fields listed below and two years or more of relevant data analyst, data science, or applied research experience.
• Ph.D. degree in data science, data analytics, business analytics, business administration, public administration/policy, research/evaluation methods, statistics, behavioral/social science, public health, computer science/MIS, management science, urban/city planning, or any field appropriate to the area of specialization.

Nice To Have
• Ability to:
• Gather and analyze information, design and test solutions to problems, and create and revise models.
• Present and communicate complex analyses to a variety of stakeholders.
• Identify data and analytics opportunities that help solve business problems.
• Build and nurture collaborative relationships with a variety of customers/partners, both internal and external.
• Successfully manage multiple priorities and projects, and work independently.
• Knowledge of:
• Data science processes and principles (i.e. business/data understanding, data preparation, modeling, data visualization, evaluation, and deployment).
• Statistics, quantitative research principles, and/or machine learning (e.g., descriptive and inferential statistics, prediction and forecasting, classification, clustering).
• Advanced skills using programming languages for data science and/or applied research (R, Python).
• Intermediate skills using with business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, SSRS, Tableau, QlikView) and/or cloud computing platforms (Azure, Databricks, Spark, Hadoop).
• Data-ops, dev-ops, or similar data project and life-cycle management approaches.
• Cloud based data science, big data, and analytics tools (e.g., DataBricks, data factory, synapse, etc.)
• Experience of:
• Statistics, quantitative research methods, and/or machine learning to solve real-world problems.
• SQL to query from large and complex databases.
• Experience working with data lake architectures and/or other cloud-based data structures.
• Experience working with graph databases.
• Familiarity with county government processes and data.

About the department:

The Strategic Planning Department guides and coordinates enterprise and cross line-of-business strategic plans, initiatives, and priorities to help ensure the successful integration of data, projects, and investments into countywide strategies.

IDA supports Hennepin County in becoming a data-informed organization that uses data consistently and effectively to support decision-making at all levels. The department works to achieve this v ia advanced data and analytics projects, data integration, and focused strategies to promote the use of data in decision making.

About Hennepin County

Hennepin is the largest county government organization in Minnesota. Our employees work every day to improve the health, safety and quality of life for our residents and communities. All of our jobs align to one or more of our overarching goals -- that Hennepin County residents are healthy, protected and safe, self-reliant, assured due process, and mobile.

Our employees receive a combination of generous benefits and positive workplace culture not found at other organizations. This includes meaningful work that impacts our community, competitive pay, work-life balance, a variety of benefits and opportunities to grow. Learn more at The Bridge - select Guest.

Hennepin County envisions an organization where our commitment to diversity and the reduction of disparities is fundamental in providing excellent service to our community.

Your future. Made here.

This posting may be used to fill current and future limited duration, grant and regular vacancies.

This position will have access to systems or other documentation that contains HIPAA data.

Invitations to interview will be based upon an assessment of education and experience.

Final candidates may be required to complete a background check.

If You Have Any Questions, Please Contact

Roberta Arpinar

Roberta.Arpinar@hennepin.us

data.job_description:
Job Summary

Purdue University and The Data Mine team are looking for an individual that is self-driven and with the ability to set and meet their own goals to become its next Data Science Technical Specialist. The Data Science Technical Specialist role reports to the Managing Director of Data Science within The Data Mine organization at Purdue University. The role focuses on the technical support of student teams as they collaborate with corporate partners throughout the academic year. These responsibilities cover the topics of data engineering, data science, and application development as well as several other domains. The position collaborates closely with the Corporate Partners team to ensure that the student team’s technical needs are being met and that planning for future technical requirements is taking place. This position takes into consideration project scope, objectives resource capacity, limitations, and project timelines while working to streamline processes and improve project workflow.

Required:
• B.S. in analytics or computation-related major (mathematics, statistics, computer science, computer information technology, predictive analytics)
• One year of experience in a related field
• Experience working in Python
• Skilled in data analytics skills and willing to learn new methods
• Ability to read and create technical documentation
• Ability to educate others on technical topics
• Ability to interact with individuals at various levels across campus and external to the university
• Must be able to be a team collaborator

Preferred:
• Additional experience in technical consulting, Web app development, Model pipelines, Production deployment, Automated code testing, and/or Advanced visualization
• Accessibility in the workplace and accessible application design
• Proficiency with NLP modeling, SQL, Database systems, HTML/Django, Tableau, and/or PowerBI
• Passion for continued education and content development
• Understanding of predictive analytics
• American Sign Language (ASL)

Additional Information:

Are you a Data Scientist looking for a new opportunity? We invite you to join one of the most successful international logistics organizations here at Kuehne+Nagel. Our Memphis branch is looking for a new Director of Data Science to join their Road Logistics team. This is a hybrid role in Memphis, TN reporting to the Global Road Logistics Product Owner. #LI-Hybrid Your Role
Kuehne + Nagel is looking to fill the position of Director of Data Science within the Information Systems organization of our North American Road Logistics department. We are looking for a hands-on technical leader for the planning, design, rollout and ongoing support to the end-users of all Data Science platforms, databases, applications, and business tools. Your Responsibilities
• As the leader of the Road Logistics Data Science team, you will be a hands-on leader tasked with defining and developing software for tasks associated with the creation, development, and ongoing support of all Data and Business Intelligence platforms and related enterprise software applications.
• You'll provide technical expertise to the Data Science and software development teams, and will design and implement changes to existing reporting platforms while leading the implementation of new cloud-based business intelligence and reporting solutions.
• Responsibilities and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment, self-management and personal accountability. Fully competent in own area of expertise.
• You will have one direct report.
Your Skills and Experiences
• 8+ years progressive experience requiring:
• Broad and extensive knowledge of the software development process, data science and associated market-leading technologies
• Strong background in report design, data transformations, programming, quality assurance, production environment troubleshooting and contributing to large, dynamic codebases
• Extensive experience in business analytics, report design, and development
• Strong experience with Tableau, Business Objects, and other market-leading BI platforms
• Experience with database design, development, creation, and maintenance

• Python within an enterprise environment
• Familiarity with HTML / Javascript / CSS
• Ajax calls within JavaScript (black box backend)
• Strong knowledge of HTML technologies and web frameworks such as:
• Django experience
• Backend operations, modeling, schemas, managers, management commands, etc.
• Extensive experience with backend management through the Django framework
• Frontend and backend development experience
• Strong in GNU+Linux OS and command line operations
• Git - medium to advanced experience
• Familiarity with management and CI/CD through interfaces like GitLab, Jira, etc.
• API development (implementing and communicating for remote services)
• AWS/ Google Cloud Platform/ Microsoft Azure – familiarity with cloud infrastructure
Good Reasons to Join
We offer a great compensation package, medical, dental, and retirement benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs and a dynamic global work environment.

data.job_description:
Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

You will be part of a newly formed department, Marketing Operations. You will help create the necessary framework and tooling used by all marketing departments. You will liaise with product teams directly to build up the needed capabilities and influence their roadmaps. You will be at the core of enabling Product Marketing, Growth, DevRel, and Brand programs to succeed by providing tools and insights to make better data-driven decisions. You will create analyses and assessments which will support department leads to prioritize their investments and understand correlations between program outputs and top-line outcomes.

You’ll be successful in this role if you’re excited to shape your discipline, use cutting-edge technology, and are eager to help support multiple teams and individuals to create effective management systems. You’ll thrive if you see opportunities for improvement everywhere and want the space to push your discipline to its full potential.

Responsibilities:
• Define the scope and build the analytics arm of Marketing Operations
• Use sophisticated modeling techniques such as causal inference to undercover insights related to user behavior, interpret data across channels to provide quick turn-around insights to brand and content teams
• Build management systems, scorecards, and data-visualization based presentations that enable marketing leaders to make better decision
• Provide projections and forecasting for platform, channel/content strategy and planning
• Solid understanding of source data, its strengths, weaknesses, semantics, and formats; solid knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional)

Qualifications:
• Understanding of econometric modeling (like regression, linear, ridge) and how to apply models to measure marketing efficiency and optimize spend, to flight and mix to maximize return on ad spend (i.e., MMM)
• Strong knowledge of SQL
• Doing analysis using Python or R, expertise across digital research and analytics tools (Google, Omniture, Tubular, Comscore)
• Experience with at least 1 BI tool (Power BI, Tableau or Looker)
• Knowledge of git versioning and control
• Advanced experimentation experience, including multivariate and causal analysis
• Strong verbal and written English communication skills

What to expect in the first 30 days
• Get to know the teams, products, and customers
• Join a Docker meetup and get to know the community and user base
• Get acquainted with the Docker culture centered around humility, developer obsession, open collaboration, and bias for considered action

What to expect in the first 90 days
• Create a plan with department leads to build solid management systems and reporting for their programs
• Drive insights and uncover investment opportunities from currently available data
• Work closely with different teams to influence decisions on infrastructure and represent marketing and its needs

What to expect in the first year
• Support overall decision-making and have solid tools and models in place to enable big investment decisions
• Use advanced ML techniques to understand user behavior and create user segments that will improve the understanding of current users' behaviors
• Support the cultural changes to become a data-driven organization by enabling a wide variety of stakeholders to understand and use data in their decision making

Perks:
• Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your life
• Variety of virtual and in-person social events to build connections and have fun
• Home office setup; we want you comfortable while you work
• Generous maternity and parental leave
• Technology stipend equivalent to $100 net/month
• PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
• Whaleness Days: companywide day off each month
• Quarterly, company-wide hackathons
• Training stipend for conferences, courses and classes
• Stock Options; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
• Docker Swag
• Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country

Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

CA/NY/CO $168,000 - $252,000
• salary range can change depending on the level

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

#LI-REMOTE

data.job_description:
Logistics at full potential.

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

1st Shift, Monday - Friday, 8:00am -5:00pm

Logistics at full potential.

GXO Logistics, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. As the Lead Data Scientist, you will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. You will conduct full life-cycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What you’ll do on a typical day:
• Lead a team of data scientists and analysts to implement models and measure success throughout the organization
• Research cutting-edge machine learning and statistical models and identify opportunities to implement into daily operations
• Communicate with technical and business-oriented audiences
• Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
• Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
• Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
• Develop statistical approaches to solve complex problems

What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:
• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, Physics or another analytics-related field, or equivalent related work or military experience
• 4 years of experience in quantitative analytics
• Experience with Microsoft Office, Airflow, Power BI, Tableau and Oracle BI, as well as Python, R, CPLEX
• Solid experience with SQL, VBA, data mining, data models and integration/extraction technologies
• Solid knowledge of statistics; experience using statistical modeling (logistic regression, SVMs, etc.) to solve business problems
• Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques, including linear/logistic regression (advanced predictor selection techniques), classification (decision trees, random forests), Support Vector Machines (SVMs), neural networks, etc.

It’d be great if you also have:
• Master’s degree in Data Science or a related field
• 7 years of experience in quantitative research
• Experience with text analytics (semantic research)
• Excellent research skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Knowledge of time series analysis and statistical assumptions as well as familiarity with forecast reconciliation

We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

GXO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with GXO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, Physics or another analytics-related field, or equivalent related work or military experience
4 years of experience in quantitative analytics
Experience with Microsoft Office, Airflow, Power BI, Tableau and Oracle BI, as well as Python, R, CPLEX
Solid experience with SQL, VBA, data mining, data models and integration/extraction technologies
Solid knowledge of statistics; experience using statistical modeling (logistic regression, SVMs, etc.)
to solve business problems
7 years of experience in quantitative research
Experience with text analytics (semantic research)
Excellent research skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of time series analysis and statistical assumptions as well as familiarity with forecast reconciliation
Responsibilities: As the Lead Data Scientist, you will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions
You will conduct full life-cycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design
Lead a team of data scientists and analysts to implement models and measure success throughout the organization
Research cutting-edge machine learning and statistical models and identify opportunities to implement into daily operations
Communicate with technical and business-oriented audiences
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Develop statistical approaches to solve complex problems

Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques, including linear/logistic regression (advanced predictor selection techniques), classification (decision trees, random forests), Support Vector Machines (SVMs), neural networks, etc
Benefits: Pay, benefits and more

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more

data.job_description:
Career Area:
Information Analytics Job Description:

Big machines require big thinking. Are you looking for your next big challenge?

Cat® Digital is the digital and technology arm of Caterpillar Inc., leveraging the latest technologies to build industry leading digital solutions for our customers and dealers. With over one million connected assets worldwide, our teams use data, technology, advanced analytics, telematics and AI capabilities to help our customers build a better world.

Working with a Fortune 100 leader, you can build your career on a global scale and take advantage of development opportunities with emerging technologies. We’ve created an inclusive environment for you to explore your passions, make an impact and do the work that really matters. Join Us.

Purpose :

Cat Digital’s Artificial Intelligence team is looking for a talented and motivated Lead Data Scientist to deliver ML/AI-based analytics to support product development for the enterprise as well as condition monitoring for customers. As a Lead Data Scientist, you will use machine learning, deep learning, neural networks, and other analytics techniques on time-series machine sensor data and other data to better understand data patterns, failure modes, device health anomalies, and more.

JOB DUTIES:
Caterpillar uses quantitative methods such as business simulations, data mining, modeling, statistical techniques, and Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence capabilities to solve real problems.

The Lead Data Scientist will:
• Demonstrate a breadth and depth of knowledge in the application of ML/AI methods and digital technology knowledge to solve complex business problems
• Coach and mentor Jr. Data Scientists in the creation, validation, and application of statistical models as well as in implementing digital solutions
• Participate on 3-4 projects concurrently
• Demonstrate thorough knowledge of Caterpillar Inc.; its products and services; its internal systems, processes, and procedures; and its relevant external influences (competitors, laws and regulations, market conditions, etc.)
• Exhibit strong initiative to research and apply new methods and digital technologies to exceed customer expectations.
• Demonstrate strong customer focus in the application of Analytics techniques and digital technologies to solve business problems
• Develop good networks within the technical community to enable them to collaborate on technical solutions, obtain resources and cooperation needed, and remove roadblocks so that they can ensure the success of their team.
• Present very good communication skills, being able to explain conclusions to customers with limited knowledge and experience with quantitative analytical methods.
• Show significant knowledge in the use of Data Analytics software solutions
• Have a strong focus on continual learning in the Analytics field

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
• Requires a Master's degree, preferably in engineering, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a similar field with quantitative coursework, and 6+ years of professional experience utilizing quantitative analysis is required, or a PhD and 4+ years of experience in relevant experience.
• 5+ years of experience applying python (NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.) programming to solve technical and business challenges.
• 3+ years of experience applying AI/ML to solve technical and business challenges.
• 1+ years of experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)

TOP CANDIDATE WILL ALSO HAVE:
• Masters, or PhD degree in Aerospace, Applied Statistics, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Science + X, Engineering (various), Informatics, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, MBA with Technical Undergrad, Predictive Analytics, Statistics, or equivalent technical degree.
• Demonstrated capability to take initiative and lead in the presence of ambiguity to deliver innovative solutions
• Experience in Generative AI
• Experience in design / development of heavy equipment (ex. automotive, aerospace, engine, transmission, construction, mining, industrial, etc)
• Experience working in a software development environment using GIT, SVN, AZDO, Clearcase, etc
• Good communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills
• Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills

Additional Details:

This position has the option to be based out of either our Chicago, IL; Peoria, IL or Champaign, IL offices with a flexible hybrid work environment.

#LI-Hybrid

#BI

This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers

EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Submit your information to our Talent Network here .

data.job_title: Human Factors Design Engineer/ Data Science
data.job_description:
Summary
Posted: Feb 21, 2023
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200464393

Apple is currently seeking an enthusiastic team player to join a dynamic and collaborative group as a data scientist on a human factors design team. You’ll have the unique opportunity to contribute to the development and continuing improvement of Apple hardware products by distilling data into actionable and intuitive visualizations from human interaction perspective. As an Austin-based team member, you will collaborate closely with Cupertino-based cross-functional team members.

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
• Candidates must be able to work independently and excel in a dynamic, hands-on, cross-functional and creative corporate environment. Ideal candidates will possess an energetic personality with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, attention to detail, patience, and aesthetic sensibility.
• This position requires strong programming skills in Python with experience working with multivariate datasets to import, clean, analyze and visualize data to enable data-driven decisions. Knowledge of population studies, dimensionality reduction, and and big data analysis is desired. Datasets include human anthropometric and biometric data as well as user study research data.
• Ideal candidates have experience analyzing and visualizing data sets in prediction and probabilistic models (e.g., Bayesian network models, Markov random field models). Candidates are enthusiastic about delving deeper into 3D data analysis and visualization. Most importantly, a great passion for creating informative visualizations and presentations to communicate results to all levels of the company.

Description

Description
As a member of this team-oriented, collaborative group, you will be working on the latest, most innovative Apple products together with many cross-functional teams.
Your responsibilities will include the following activities:
Write scripts to pre-process data from various sources and formats.
Process, clean, and verify the integrity of data. Investigate new sources that can extend and improve insights.
Conduct data exploration on datasets, QA/QC, visualization, statistical and data analyses, and mathematical modeling.
Create custom visualizations that help decision makers quickly understand the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to help identify trends in their data or to build tools that will enable easier analysis and visualizations in the future.

The role will require close collaboration with human factor design engineers, computer vision scientists, data scientists, and product engineers with many opportunities to practice and grow communication skills. You’ll have a lot of latitude to define how you work; specific tools matter less than the lateral thinking they enable. This is a truly unique opportunity that exposes you to many different teams at Apple.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience
Masters degree in an analytical field such as (but not limited to) Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Biological Sciences, Robotics, Climate or Environmental Science, along with 2+ years relevant work experience. Ph.D. degree preferred.

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

data.job_title: Arity - Data Scientist - Expert ML Researcher
data.job_description:
Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone.

At the heart of that mission are the people that work here-the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation.

That's because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn't be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don't just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.

The Role:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Scientist - Expert ML Researcher to work across Arity and tackle our toughest technical challenges to lay the foundation for future success in coming years. As a member of the Core Telematics Data Science team, you will enjoy the strong partnership and collaboration of other data scientists and experts who are as passionate about shaping the future of mobility data science as you are. You will shape the research roadmap by finding the most impactful projects and help establish our research strategy for how we engage internal teams as well as external partners. Your experience in multiple companies and domains will lend itself to helping our teams improve their technical capabilities. You will consult on DS/ML architecture and patterns to help teams avoid common pitfalls in data science projects. As an expert technical data scientist within Arity, you will advocate for the needs of data science broadly, lead the entire data scientist discipline by example, and coach and mentor across the team.

Responsibilities:
• Make deep technical contributions to the Core Telematics Data Science team by building models, pipelines, or prototypes and reviewing the contributions of others
• Key contributor to the vision, strategy and roadmap of the Core Telematics Data Science team using your technical expertise and domain knowledge
• Encourage risk taking and innovation while keeping an eye towards business value
• Help Arity continue to improve data science and ML practices across the team, and consult across product teams on DS/ML architecture, patterns and best practices
• Bring in external viewpoints on how best to do telematics data science via scientific literature, conferences, speakers, and contacts across industries
• Contribute to the broader data science community via technical blogs, white papers and speaking events. Help shape Arity's approach to creating a strong external presence
• Help support our culture of intellectual honesty and openness, passion for what we do, hard work, and personal growth.
• Build the Arity technical brand by engaging in conferences, meetups, blogs, and other external public engagements
• Support recruiting by leading efforts to build relationships in the industry, attend career fairs and create strong interviewing pipelines

Qualifications:
• Advanced degree in Geospatial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering, or related quantitative field preferred
• Deep subject matter expertise in data science gained from academic studies and/or significant experience as a top echelon data scientist or researcher at multiple companies
• Strong technical capability to build models, pipelines, prototypes, visualizations and analyses using standard data science tool sets, e.g. Python, R, Spark, C
• Broad knowledge of the landscape of statistical and machine learning techniques (both traditional and deep learning). Proven ability to find the right approach and manage trade-off's
• Strong research capabilities to synthesize the literature and other sources of new ideas, identify potential new avenues of development, and communicate their value to our business
• Passion for technical mentorship across the larger team, and ability to manage a few highly self-sufficient technical contributors
• Solid communication skills to drive adoption of your innovations and better understand the company and its strategy
• Knowledge in sensors, telematics, insurance, geospatial, data science on the edge, or other domains specifically relevant to our work is a big plus, but not required
• Ability to envision and articulate radical change through highly innovative thought leadership
• Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with high ambiguity; inspires others to embrace this
• Competitive with themselves while being humble

Notes:

The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.

Compensation offered for this role is$154,400.00-$210,350.00 per yearand is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

That's the day-to-day, now let's talk about the rest of it. As we mentioned, Arity was founded by The Allstate Corporation. But you'll be working for-and at-Arity. It's the best of both worlds. You'll get access to the full suite of Allstate benefits and work in a fast-paced startup culture. That's more than just free breakfasts and brain breaks. It's a culture that encourages you to be you.

Sound like a fit? Apply now! We can't wait to meet you.

Arity.comInstagramTwitter LinkedIn

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.
